intro: Hieracium cephalothales, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and features showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that attract pollinators. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium cephalothales is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
